definition: used in the phrase 'to your credit' in order to indicate an achievement deserving praise, to have trust in
details:
noun
- used in the phrase 'to your credit' in order to indicate an achievement deserving praise
= example: used in the phrase 'to your credit' in order to indicate an achievement deserving praise
- recognition by a college or university that a course of studies has been successfully completed
= synonyms: course credit
- an estimate, based on previous dealings, of a person's or an organization's ability to fulfill their financial commitments
= synonyms: credit rating
- an entry on a list of persons who contributed to a film or written work
= example: an entry on a list of persons who contributed to a film or written work
- approval
= synonyms: recognition
- a short note recognizing a source of information or of a quoted passage
= synonyms: quotation, reference, citation, mention, cite
- arrangement for deferred payment for goods and services
= synonyms: deferred payment
- money available for a client to borrow
- an accounting entry acknowledging income or capital items
= synonyms: credit entry
verb
- to have trust in
- to give someone credit for something
= example: to give someone credit for something
- to ascribe an achievement to
= example: to ascribe an achievement to
= synonyms: accredit
- to enter as credit, in accounting
= example: to enter as credit, in accounting
